questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_0^2 x^3\sqrt{x^4+7}\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi}\sin^2 x\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_4^{4e^2}\dfrac{5}{x}\,dx\).
A particle moves along the x‑axis with velocity \(v(t)=t^2-5t+4\) m/s. On the interval \([0,5]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Set \(v(t)=0\): \((t-1)(t-4)=0\) ⇒ \(t=1\) and \(t=4\). Check signs: \(v(0)=4>0\), \(v(2)=4-10+4=-2<0\), \(v(5)=25-25+4=4>0\). Velocity changes sign at both \(t=1\) and \(t=4\), so the particle changes direction 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x)=4x^3\) on the interval \([0,2]\).
Let \(f(x)=x^5+x-1\). Which of the following correctly applies the Intermediate Value Theorem to guarantee a zero?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(f(0)=0+0-1=-1<0\) and \(f(1)=1+1-1=1>0\). Since \(f\) is continuous and changes sign on \([0,1]\), there is a zero in \((0,1)\). The other intervals have the same sign at both endpoints.

questions.question: Find the general solution to \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\dfrac{y^2}{x}\).
questions.explanation: Separate: \(\frac{dy}{y^2}=\frac{dx}{x}\). Integrate: \(-\frac{1}{y}=\ln|x|+C_1\). Solve: \(y=-\frac{1}{\ln x+C_1}=\frac{1}{C-\ln x}\), where \(C=-C_1\).

questions.question: Let \(T(x)=\int_1^{x^3}(t^2+1)^4\,dt\). Find \(T'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC Part 1 and the chain rule: \(T'(x)=((x^3)^2+1)^4\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^3)=(x^6+1)^4\cdot3x^2=3x^2(x^6+1)^4\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=\sin(e^x)\).
Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x)=\tan^3 x\).
questions.explanation: Write \(f(x)=(\tan x)^3\). Chain rule: \(f'(x)=3(\tan x)^2\cdot\sec^2 x=3\tan^2 x\sec^2 x\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}\dfrac{x^2-9}{x-3} & x\ne3\\k & x=3\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=3\)?
Find the x‑value of the inflection point of \(f(x)=x^3+3x^2-9x+2\).
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=3x^2+6x-9\), \(f''(x)=6x+6=6(x+1)\). Set \(f''=0\): \(x=-1\). Since \(f''\) changes sign at \(x=-1\) (negative for \(x<-1\), positive for \(x>-1\)), there is an inflection point at \(x=-1\).

questions.question: Use implicit differentiation to find \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\) for \(x^2y^3=8\).
Find the equation of the normal line to \(y=\ln x\) at the point \((1,0)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=\frac{1}{x}\). At \(x=1\): tangent slope \(=1\). Normal slope \(=-1\). Equation: \(y-0=-1(x-1)\), so \(y=-x+1\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\arctan(x^2)\). Find the instantaneous rate of change of \(f\) at \(x=1\).
If \(g(-2)=3\) and \(g(5)=10\), find \(\int_{-2}^5 g'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_{-2}^5 g'(x)\,dx=g(5)-g(-2)=10-3=7\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=e^x\) on \([0,2]\), the Mean Value Theorem guarantees a \(c\in(0,2)\) where \(f'(c)\) equals the average rate of change. Which equation determines \(c\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(0)=1\), \(f(2)=e^2\). Average rate \(=\frac{e^2-1}{2}\). Set \(f'(c)=e^c=\frac{e^2-1}{2}\). So \(c=\ln\!\left(\frac{e^2-1}{2}\right)\approx1.16\), which lies in \((0,2)\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=x^3\ln x\).
A particle has velocity \(v(t)=2t^3-9t^2+12t-5\) ft/s on \([0,3]\). Find the minimum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the intervals on which \(f(x)=x^4-8x^3+16x^2\) is decreasing.
Which of the following functions is NOT differentiable at \(x=0\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(x)=x^{1/3}\) has a vertical tangent at \(x=0\): \(f'(x)=\frac{1}{3}x^{-2/3}\to\infty\) as \(x\to0\). The others — \(x^{4/3}\), \(x^{5/3}\), \(x^2\) — are all differentiable at \(x=0\) with derivative 0.

questions.question: A car travels at \(v(t)=60-2t\) mph. How many miles does it travel from \(t=0\) to \(t=20\) hours?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) changes from negative to positive at \(x=-2\); from positive to negative at \(x=0\); and equals zero at \(x=3\) with \(f'\) negative on both sides. Classify each critical point.
options: Min at \(-2\), max at \(0\), neither at \(3\)
Max at \(-2\), min at \(0\), neither at \(3\)
Min at \(-2\), max at \(0\), min at \(3\)
Max at \(-2\), min at \(0\), max at \(3\)
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: − to + at \(x=-2\) ⇒ relative minimum; + to − at \(x=0\) ⇒ relative maximum; no sign change at \(x=3\) ⇒ neither.

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=1+x^2\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=3\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)<0\), \(f'(a)>0\), and \(f''(a)>0\). Which description best matches the behavior near \(x=a\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(a)<0\) means below the x‑axis; \(f'(a)>0\) means increasing; \(f''(a)>0\) means concave up.

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_{-3}^{3}(4x^3-2x+7)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: The functions \(4x^3\) and \(-2x\) are both odd, so their integrals over \([-3,3]\) equal zero. Only the constant \(7\) contributes: \(\int_{-3}^3 7\,dx=7\cdot6=42\). Total \(=0+0+42=42\).

questions.question: Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=6x-x^2\) and \(y=x^2-2x\).
For \(f(x)=x^4-4x^3+6\), the second derivative is \(f''(x)=12x(x-2)\). On which interval is \(f\) concave down?
questions.explanation: \(f''(x)=12x(x-2)<0\) when \(x\) and \(x-2\) have opposite signs, i.e., \(0<x<2\). So \(f\) is concave down on \((0,2)\).

questions.question: Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=x^2e^x\) at \(x=1\).
questions.explanation: \(f(1)=1\cdot e=e\). Product rule: \(f'(x)=2xe^x+x^2e^x=e^x x(2+x)\), so \(f'(1)=e\cdot1\cdot3=3e\). Tangent: \(y-e=3e(x-1)\), i.e., \(y=3e(x-1)+e\).

questions.question: The length \(l\) and width \(w\) of a rectangle satisfy \(l=2w\). If the width is increasing at 3 cm/s, how fast is the area increasing when \(w=5\) cm?
A logistic model gives \(P(t)=\dfrac{1000}{1+9e^{-t}}\). What is the population when \(t=\ln 9\)?
Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=x^3+6x^2+9x+1\) using the First Derivative Test.
options: Relative max at \(x=-3\) (\(f=1\)); relative min at \(x=-1\) (\(f=-3\))
Relative min at \(x=-3\); relative max at \(x=-1\)
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=3x^2+12x+9=3(x+1)(x+3)\). Critical: \(x=-1,-3\). Sign of \(f'\): positive for \(x<-3\), negative for \(-3<x<-1\), positive for \(x>-1\). So: relative max at \(x=-3\) (\(f(-3)=-27+54-27+1=1\)) and relative min at \(x=-1\) (\(f(-1)=-1+6-9+1=-3\)).

questions.question: Find the value of \(k\) that makes \(f(x)=\begin{cases}kx^2+2 & x\le1\\4x-1 & x>1\end{cases}\) continuous at \(x=1\).
questions.explanation: Right limit: \(4(1)-1=3\). Left limit (and value): \(k(1)^2+2=k+2\). Set equal: \(k+2=3\) ⇒ \(k=1\). Verify: \(1+2=3\) ✓

questions.question: Use the Trapezoidal Rule with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^2 x^3\,dx\).
Find the critical points of \(f(x)=\cos x-\sin x\) on \([0,2\pi]\).
The region bounded by \(y=x^3\) and \(y=0\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=2\) is rotated about the x‑axis. Find the volume.
At what point on \(y=\ln x\) is the tangent line parallel to \(y=\dfrac{1}{2}x+3\)?
questions.explanation: Slope of given line \(=\frac{1}{2}\). Set \(y'=\frac{1}{x}=\frac{1}{2}\) ⇒ \(x=2\). Then \(y=\ln 2\). Point: \((2,\ln 2)\).

questions.question: Consider \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2-x+1 & x<1\\\sqrt{x} & x\ge1\end{cases}\). Is \(f\) differentiable at \(x=1\)?
options: No; \(f\) is continuous but the left derivative is 1 and the right derivative is \(\tfrac{1}{2}\)
Yes; both pieces give the same value at \(x=1\)
questions.explanation: Continuity: \(f(1^-)=1-1+1=1\) and \(f(1^+)=\sqrt{1}=1\) ✓. Left derivative: \(2x-1\big|_1=1\). Right derivative: \(\frac{1}{2\sqrt{x}}\big|_1=\frac{1}{2}\). Since \(1\ne\frac{1}{2}\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=1\).

questions.question: Let \(A(x)=\int_0^{x^2}\cos(t^3)\,dt\). Find \(A'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC and the chain rule: \(A'(x)=\cos((x^2)^3)\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^2)=\cos(x^6)\cdot2x=2x\cos(x^6)\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\displaystyle\lim_{x\to0}\frac{e^{3x}-1-3x}{x^2}\).
questions.explanation: Form \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply L'Hôpital: \(\frac{3e^{3x}-3}{2x}\). Still \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply again: \(\frac{9e^{3x}}{2}\to\frac{9}{2}\). Alternatively, using the Taylor expansion \(e^{3x}=1+3x+\frac{9x^2}{2}+\cdots\), the numerator \(\sim\frac{9x^2}{2}\), giving limit \(\frac{9}{2}\).

questions.question: A Norman window (a rectangle topped by a semicircle) has a perimeter of 10 m. The radius of the semicircle is \(r\). What value of \(r\) maximizes the total area?
questions.explanation: Width \(=2r\), rectangular height \(=h\). Perimeter: \(2h+2r+\pi r=10\) ⇒ \(h=\frac{10-2r-\pi r}{2}\). Area \(A=2rh+\frac{\pi r^2}{2}=10r-2r^2-\frac{\pi r^2}{2}\). \(\frac{dA}{dr}=10-4r-\pi r=0\) ⇒ \(r=\frac{10}{4+\pi}\).

questions.question: Use the Second Derivative Test to classify all critical points of \(f(x)=\dfrac{x^4}{4}-2x^2+3\).
options: Local max at \(x=0\) (\(f=3\)); local minima at \(x=\pm2\) (\(f=-1\))
Local min at \(x=0\); local maxima at \(x=\pm2\)

questions.question: Use a left Riemann sum with \(n=3\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^3(2x+1)\,dx\).
Find \(\dfrac{d}{dx}\left[x^2\arctan x\right]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=\dfrac{t^4}{2}-4t^2\). Find the acceleration at each time when the velocity is zero.
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=x^3-3x\) on \([-2,3]\).
options: Absolute max \(18\) at \(x=3\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=-2\) and \(x=1\)
Absolute max \(18\) at \(x=3\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=1\) only
Absolute max \(2\) at \(x=-1\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=1\)
Absolute max \(18\) at \(x=3\); absolute min \(-2\) at \(x=-2\) only

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=y\tan x\), \(y(0)=3\).
questions.explanation: Separate: \(\frac{dy}{y}=\tan x\,dx\) ⇒ \(\ln|y|=-\ln|\cos x|+C\) ⇒ \(y=\frac{A}{\cos x}=A\sec x\). Apply \(y(0)=3\): \(A\sec(0)=A=3\). So \(y=3\sec x=\frac{3}{\cos x}\).

questions.question: A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=t^2-2t-3\) ft/s on \([0,4]\). Find the total distance traveled.
Differentiate \(f(x)=e^{\sin(x^2)}\).
Use linear approximation at \(x=0\) to estimate \((1.02)^{10}\).
